definition: An introduction at the beginning of a book, usually written by the author, explaining the purpose or context of the book.
example: The preface of the novel explained why the author chose to write about his childhood.

definition: A phrase used to show that one action causes another or is connected to another.
example: She studied hard for her exams and, in doing so, improved her grades significantly.

definition: Intentionally; done on purpose rather than by accident.
example: He deliberately left the meeting early to avoid answering difficult questions.

definition: Voluntarily; because someone has decided to, not because they were forced.
example: She lives in the countryside by choice, even though the city offers more opportunities.

definition: Automatically; happening because no alternative was chosen.
example: He became the team leader by default because no one else volunteered.

definition: To extract the essential meaning or most important part of something.
example: The teacher tried to distill the complex theory into a few simple points.

definition: To begin doing something, usually with a plan or purpose.
example: She set about organizing her notes for the big presentation.

definition: To collect information or items from various sources and put them together.
example: He compiled a list of the best restaurants in the city for his blog.

definition: Sincere and deeply felt; showing genuine emotion.
example: She gave a heartfelt speech thanking everyone for their support.

definition: With strong optimism or expectation that something good will happen.
example: He wrote the letter in the high hope that it would reach the right person.

definition: To take action based on advice, information, or knowledge.
example: If you want to improve your health, you must act on the doctorâ€™s recommendations.

definition: A test, challenge, or difficult experience.
example: She faced many trials before finally achieving her dream of becoming a doctor.

definition: To improve or enhance the quality, value, or meaning of something.
example: Traveling can enrich your understanding of different cultures.

definition: Success, wealth, or good fortune, often both financial and personal.
example: Hard work and determination can lead to prosperity in life.

definition: To feel or show great joy or happiness.
example: When she received the award, she could not help but rejoice with her friends.

definition: A weapon that is launched and can travel through the air to hit a target, often used in military contexts.
example: The country tested a new missile that could reach targets hundreds of miles away.

definition: To locate or identify something with great accuracy.
example: Scientists were able to pinpoint the source of the earthquake.

definition: To attend an appointment, meeting, or scheduled time with someone.
example: I promised to keep a date with my teacher at 3 p.m. to discuss my project.

definition: A device that sends printed documents over a telephone line.
example: Before email became popular, the office relied on a fax machine to send contracts quickly.

definition: To have the special right or honor to do something.
example: I have the privilege to meet the president during the ceremony.

definition: To move or pass into something gradually or without notice.
example: Days slip into weeks when you are busy with work.

definition: The bed on which someone is dying; used figuratively to refer to the last moments of life.
example: On his deathbed, he told his children how much he loved them.

definition: A long, deep breath expressing relief, sadness, or tiredness.
example: She let out a sigh after finishing the difficult exam.

definition: The main or central speech at a conference or event.
example: The CEO delivered the keynote at the annual business conference.

definition: The ability to guide, direct, or inspire others.
example: Her leadership skills helped the team complete the project ahead of schedule.

definition: A deep understanding of a person, situation, or concept.
example: His book provides valuable insight into human behavior.

definition: Always; without change.
example: He invariably arrives at work before 8 a.m.

definition: To focus primarily on something.
example: The discussion centered on ways to improve education.

definition: To make something easier or less complicated.
example: We need to simplify the instructions so everyone can understand.

definition: A strong inner impulse toward a particular career or purpose in life.
example: She felt a calling to become a teacher and help children learn.

definition: Deserving respect, attention, or effort.
example: He made a worthy contribution to the charity.

definition: Having high moral qualities or ideals.
example: She pursued a noble goal of helping the poor.

definition: A goal or purpose someone aims to achieve.
example: The main objective of the project is to reduce pollution.

definition: To show or demonstrate something clearly.
example: His dedication manifested in the way he helped everyone in the team.
